description: COOLForge custom field definitions for Level.io

prerequisites: Level.io API key with 'Custom Fields' permission (get from https://app.level.io/api-keys)
Your company/MSP name for the scratch folder path
(If using private repo) GitHub Personal Access Token with 'Contents' read permission - create at github.com/settings/tokens
setup.description: This wizard creates and configures custom fields in your Level.io account. Have the information above ready before starting.
notes: NEW ACCOUNTS: If you have a new Level.io account, API access may need to be enabled by Level.io support before you can use the API. Contact support if you receive connection errors.

level_api.description: These fields enable Level.io API automation (wake devices, run scripts across folders, etc.)
prerequisites: A second Level.io API key for scripts to use (can be the same as setup, but recommended to create a dedicated one)

screenconnect.description: These fields enable ScreenConnect (ConnectWise Control) integration for remote access management.
prerequisites: ScreenConnect instance ID (found in ScreenConnect admin settings) - for whitelisting scripts
(Optional) ScreenConnect API credentials if using automation features

huntress.description: These fields enable automated Huntress agent deployment and management.
prerequisites: Huntress account key (from Huntress dashboard > Agents > Deploy)
Huntress organization key (from Huntress dashboard > Agents > Deploy)

unchecky.description: These fields enable automated Unchecky deployment using the 5-tag policy model. Tags override custom field policy.
prerequisites: Host the installer on a publicly accessible URL (S3, Azure Blob, web server, etc.)

technician_alerts.description: These fields enable the technician alert notification system. Alerts appear on technician workstations tagged with the technician emoji.
prerequisites: Tag technician workstations with the technician emoji tag in Level.io

debugging.description: These fields enable verbose debug output for troubleshooting COOLForge scripts.

policy_readme.description: Read-only field explaining how COOLForge policies work. Always appears first in policy_ field list.

device_blocking.description: Control whether policies can make changes on a device. Defaults to 'block' for safety.

chrome.description: Chrome Enterprise software deployment and browser configuration policies.

prerequisites: MeshCentral agent installer URLs for Windows, Linux, Mac

windows_config.description: Windows OS-level configuration policies (location services, etc).

chrome_config.description: Chrome browser configuration policies (location, extensions, etc).

core.name: coolforge_msp_scratch_folder
core.description: Persistent storage folder for MSP scripts and libraries (default: C:\ProgramData\COOLForge)
core.prompt: Where should COOLForge store scripts and libraries on endpoints?

core.name: coolforge_ps_module_library_source
core.description: URL to download COOLForge-Common.psm1 library (leave empty for official repo)
core.prompt: Custom library URL (leave empty to use official COOLForge repo)

core.name: coolforge_pin_psmodule_to_version
core.description: Pin scripts to a specific version tag (e.g., v2025.12.29)
core.prompt: Pin to a specific version? (leave empty for latest)

core.name: coolforge_pat
core.description: GitHub Personal Access Token for private repositories. Required if hosting COOLForge scripts in a private GitHub repo. Create at github.com/settings/tokens with 'repo' scope (read access). Token is stored as admin-only field so it's hidden from non-admin users.
core.prompt: GitHub PAT for private repo access (leave empty if using public repo)
core.help: Create a fine-grained PAT at github.com/settings/tokens with read-only 'Contents' permission for your repo

core.name: coolforge_nosleep_duration_min
core.description: Duration in minutes to prevent device from sleeping (default: 60)
core.prompt: How long should NoSleep scripts keep devices awake? (minutes)

level_api.name: apikey
level_api.description: Level.io API key for automation scripts (admin-only)
level_api.prompt: Level.io API key for script automation

screenconnect.name: screenconnect_instance_id
screenconnect.description: Your MSP's ScreenConnect instance ID for whitelisting

screenconnect.name: is_screenconnect_server
screenconnect.description: Set to 'true' on devices hosting ScreenConnect server

screenconnect.name: screenconnect_device_url
screenconnect.description: Per-device ScreenConnect URL (populated automatically by scripts)

huntress.name: huntress_account_key
huntress.description: Huntress account key for agent deployment
huntress.prompt: Huntress account key (from Dashboard > Agents > Deploy)

huntress.name: huntress_organization_key
huntress.description: Huntress organization key for agent deployment
huntress.prompt: Huntress organization key (from Dashboard > Agents > Deploy)

huntress.name: huntress_tags
huntress.description: Comma-separated tags to apply to Huntress agent

unchecky.name: policy_unchecky
unchecky.description: Default Unchecky policy: install, remove, pin, or empty. Tags override this value.

unchecky.name: policy_unchecky_url
unchecky.description: URL to download Unchecky installer. Required for installation. Get installer from https://www.fosshub.com/Unchecky.html and host it yourself.
unchecky.prompt: URL to your hosted Unchecky installer (required)

technician_alerts.name: coolforge_technician_alerts
technician_alerts.description: JSON array of pending alerts for technicians (managed by scripts). Technician workstations are identified by the technician emoji tag.

debugging.name: debug_scripts
debugging.description: Enable verbose debug output in COOLForge scripts. Set to 'true' to show all variables, tags, policy resolution, and diagnostic information.

policy_readme.name: policy_0_readme
policy_readme.description: Documentation for COOLForge policy system. This field explains how policy_ fields work.
policy_readme.default: COOLForge Policies - Format: value - docs. Values: pin/install/remove. Tags override. See: github.com/COOLNetworksAU/COOLForge/blob/main/docs/POLICY-FIELDS.md

device_blocking.name: policy_block_device
device_blocking.description: Block all policy changes on this device. Default 'block' prevents changes until explicitly unblocked. Set to 'unblock' or 'allow' to enable policy enforcement.
device_blocking.prompt: Block policy changes on this device? (block/unblock)

chrome.name: policy_chrome
chrome.description: Chrome Enterprise software policy: install, remove, pin. Uses 5-tag model.

meshcentral.name: policy_meshcentral
meshcentral.description: MeshCentral agent policy: install, remove, pin. Uses 5-tag model.

meshcentral.name: policy_meshcentral_download_url
meshcentral.description: URL to MeshCentral Windows agent installer

meshcentral.name: policy_meshcentral_mac_download_url
meshcentral.description: URL to MeshCentral Mac agent installer

windows_config.name: policy_device_locationservices
windows_config.description: Windows Location Services policy: install (enable), remove (disable), pin. Uses 5-tag model.

chrome_config.name: policy_chrome_locationservices
chrome_config.description: Chrome geolocation policy: install (allow prompts), remove (block), pin. Auto-enables Windows location if needed. Uses 5-tag model.
